job_title: End User Support Specialist II in Stephenville, TX
pros: Tarleton pays for most of the insurance premiums for BCBS.
cons: Lower-level employees are constantly overworked & underpaid while working for older people that are just waiting for retirement. There is very little to no room for advancement unless someone retires or leaves the university.

pros: The student experience at Tarleton I think is quite good. People working at Tarleton really do care about the students.
cons: Finding out how much comparable staff make an other A&M campuses was disheartening. We interviewed someone who was making equivalent to me. They were entry level and I was several levels above them. So clearly, they dropped out. We couldn’t hire staff to fill positions because we pay so poorly. Constantly trying to stay afloat with severe staffing shortages. Both full time and student worker. This has been going on for years. I burned out.

review_title: Friendly staff, underpaid, tons of hidden tasks
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Stephenville, TX
pros:
Office staff is very friendly and helpful. Office staff = student workers at the office. A few professors are very nice too.
Math Dept Head Dr. Brawner is a great leader.
cons:
✅ Being "voluntold" to participate/help in all sorts of events, which are completely unrelated to the class you are teaching. 
✅ This happens weekly. 
✅ You are probably valued more and treated better by McDonald's management.
✅ Being called for meetings whenever your supervisor feels like.
✅ Supervisor being late / not attending meetings led by them.
✅ Not knowing who to report to, because chain of command is unclear/disrupted.
✅ Picking up slack from colleagues is part of your daily job.
✅ Raise / extra / after hours pay? NO.

review_title: Bleed Purple, but don't expect a raise...
pros: Great place to work in Erath County. Good benefits, schedule, and work/life balance. Some great managers within the organization as a whole.
cons: Don't pay people based on skills, or market value. A lot of nepotism within the organization. Can be hard to get your foot in the door because of these issues. Many people are over qualified and underpaid and make a sacrifice to work in this particular organization because of convenience.

pros: For the Academic Resource Center- Great SI & Tutoring programs, from the perspective of both students and employees. Bosses have high standards, and yet are still laid back and chill to interact with.
cons: None major to speak of. Maybe more prep time rfor some of the harder subjects. Could maybe use a few more computers for the SI's to use, but that is not the department's fault. It is merely a function of budgeting and space.

review_title: A lot of work for nothing
job_title: Graduate Assistant Housing in Stephenville, TX
pros: You get to work with awesome student leaders and workers. You can make some impact on students lives.
cons: No communication amongst pro staff and upper staff. Toxic work environment. You have 35 set hours but you do whatever you're told whenever they want you there. On call is a mess because there is no consistency and training is minimal. Punished for seeking outside opportunities.

pros: You really can't get fired & vacation/holidays are great.
cons: I loved my job until people began to get shuffled around and 'put' in areas that allowed upper management to accomplish their goals. You will not get promoted, more money, or help no matter how much you deserve or need it. It has become so corrupt that everyone is leaving.

pros: The hours were really flexible and the staff and faculty I worked with were great. I worked in the accounting department at the Tarleton-Waco outreach campus located on the Mclennan Community College campus. If no one is in the lab then I was able to work on homework.
cons: When I first started we had to move the accounting lab to different rooms on different days, but recently we partnered with the tutoring lab on the MCC campus and have been consistently in the same area.

job_title: Program Manager in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great health insurance, retirement, and co-workers.
cons: There is little chance of promotion unless you went to Tarleton for your schooling.  Also the organization of has a way to complicated structure.   In addition they are looking for a new President, which always adds more confusion.

review_title: Flexible and friendly work environment for students and graduates alike.
pros: Laid back atmosphere, no "big brother" monitoring like some state agencies, no drug test, do your work right and get treated with respect. Most departments are friendly and helpful.
cons: Not all departments are friendly and helpful, bathrooms are usually filthy from students, hours are limited for student workers, some questionable choices in which holidays are off days, and parking is horrific.

job_title: Student Technician II in Stephenville, TX
pros: Ability to do work-study programs enables students to earn money while having the ability to take off for classes / projects. Very flexible
cons: As a student worker, pay and promotions are zilch depending upon external forces. Only raises I received after two and a half years was due to cost of living increase when minimum wage increased.

review_title: It's a great place to start getting experience
pros: You honestly never know what you'll be attending that day, or who you'll be meeting. From state senators and governors, to the board of regents. It's a great place to start getting a head start in the professional world and teaches you wonderful work etiquette.  The overall sense of family on campus goes without compare.
cons: The distance from major cities is a little far. Salaries seem a little low as well.

pros: Working with Tarleton State is like family, you feel like you belong. Benefits of working for a University are satisfying and everyone enjoys their work.
cons: Tarleton State struggles like any family does.  While Tarleton State is moving towards a better future, it has moved at a slower pace than some other Universities.

job_title: Supplemental Instructor and Teacher Aid in Stephenville, TX
pros: The people are wonderful. I recommend working for the school every chance I get. There is a culture of support and kindness. This company actually brings their core values to work with them every day
cons: The pay is low. However this is fair for the amount of responsibility of the student worker's job. Your pay is low but so is your inconvenience and stress level. All-in-all it is a fair wage

job_title: Assistant Research Scientist in Stephenville, TX
pros: The work was engaging and the hours were very flexable. It gave me a good chance to work with other students.
cons: The hours can be long and sometimes fruitless. Experiments, once started, must be completed. Working with lab mates can sometimes prove to be difficult.

job_title: Circulation Student Worker in Stephenville, TX
pros: The D. Smith Library Staff at Tarleton State University are helpful in getting their students to do their best in the work force.
cons: There aren't enough hours to work for their multiple student workers, in that it is such a wonderful job I wish I could do more for the school.

review_title: Great family atmosphere, unfortunately mom and dad are stingy with the allowance
pros: Family atmosphere, friendly people, nice town, no traffic
cons: Salaries are well behind the times for regular staff.  Promises to review and correct come along every couple of years, but nothing ever comes of it.  Executive staff very well compensated.  If you go to work for Tarleton, try to become a VP.

pros: Only have to work 20 hours a week. Get books for classes. Benefits. Ability to communicate and build relationships with professors.
cons: None of the school paid for. not really any chance for career opportunities unless you plan on being in academia for your career

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Stephenville, TX
pros: You get to work with students one-on-one to help them learn as well as work with the professors. Its like family within the department. Everybody looks out for each other and is proud to work for the kinesiology department.
cons: As a graduate assistant, you do not get many benefits regarding paid tuition or fees. You only receive a monthly stipend.

job_title: Development Executive in Spring Branch, TX
pros: There is an awesome friendly environment at Tarleton State University that you can't find anywhere else. The people are always looking to help one another.
cons: There is a ton of red tape you must go through to get anything big done. This is common for four year universities but it gets in the way.

pros: If you were an accounting student this job would be very easy for you. In the lab has all solution books that you can provide answers to students. Usually, you keep answer the same questions and answer for a period of time for students' assignments.
cons: No con. You will love this job.

pros: Flexible hours and light workload. I am also able to focus on my graduate school work when ever I have a big project.
cons: Sometimes I have to work in the accounting lab and it can be difficult because I did not specialize in accounting.

pros: Flexible with student schedules. A lot of free gear comes with the job. I was able to gain a lot of experience in my field.
cons: Hard to separate work and personal life. Not enough pay for a full-time student to live on unless you have multiple jobs.

pros: Nothing beats the look on a student face when they come back from a test the aces because of what you taught them
cons: The pay wasn’t anything and my coworkers always needed my assistance

pros: Gain experience that was helpful to further my education and future career and well as opportunities to attend conferences related to degee
cons: I had an excellent opportunity I would just add need for more support and updates in technical tools

cons: Sometimes professors come in and drop off stuff for us to grade without asking if we have a break in our work to help them.

pros: Awesome experience and awesome to get to work with your peers.
cons: No cons with this one!  I worked for the department of Engineering Technology and it opened so many doors in my life!

pros: Very flexible with school schedules and it was enjoyable work.
cons: The pay is not great, but for what is expected of you and the flexibility that comes with job, it is still a good gig.
